alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds in which the largest metallic oxoanion is borate, to which either no atom or a non metal atom is bonded.
alternative_parents.name: Miscellaneous borates

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic halogenic compounds in which the heaviest metal atom is a metalloid.
alternative_parents.name: Metalloid salts

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic salt compounds containing a sodium atom either in its ionic form or bonded to another atom (metal or halogen).
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic sodium salts

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic chemical compounds with one or more oxygen atoms combined with another element.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic oxides

class.description: Inorganic oxoanionic compounds in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is an alkali metal.
class.name: Alkali metal oxoanionic compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as alkali metal borates. These are inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is borate, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is an alkali metal.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is borate, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is an alkali metal.
direct_parent.name: Alkali metal borates

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is borate, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is an alkali metal.
subclass.name: Alkali metal borates

superclass.description: Compounds that contains both metal and non metal atoms.
superclass.name: Mixed metal/non-metal compounds
